metadata.title: CVE-2016-10253 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Erlang/OTP 18.x. Erlang's generation of compiledregular expressions is vulnerable to a heap overflow. Regular expressionsusing a malformed extpattern can indirectly specify an offset that is usedas an array index. This ordinal permits arbitrary regions within theerts_alloc arena to be both read and written to.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

erlang - 1:18.3-dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
erlang-asn1 - 1:18.3-dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
erlang-base - 1:18.3-dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
erlang-base-hipe - 1:18.3-dfsg-1ubuntu3.1

criterions.comment: erlang package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:18.3-dfsg-1ubuntu3.1').
